intro: Lippia uncinuligera, commonly known as the hairy lippia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Verbenaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are usually hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. Lippia uncinuligera is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its visual appeal and fragrance.
